title: AutoCAD 1003 Weekly Quiz
description: Please choose the correct answer for the quiz. Refer to your textbook as you complete the assessment.
q1N: In AutoCAD, the default setting direction "straight down" would be measured as degrees.
q2N: The rule for creating CAD drawings is that a computer drawing should be created using real-world units.
q2c1: to a proportion of the actual object
q2c4: proportional to the size of the screen
q4c1: a series of pull-down menus along the top of the Drawing Editor
q4c2: a list of options for managing drawing files
q5N: A shortcut menu is activated by.
q5c1: selecting an item from the Menu Bar with ellipsis.
q5c4: holding down the Ctrl key and clicking inside a dialog box
q6N: In order to cancel a command, press the key(s).
q7c1: force lines to a horizontal or vertical alignment
q7c3: make the crosshairs "jump" to regular intervals
q8N: Polar Tracking (F10) makes it easy to.
q8c2: track the coordinate position of the cursor
q8c3: draw lines at regular angular increments
q8c4: force lines to either vertical or horizontal alignment
q9N: Grid (F7) can be turned On to.
q9c1: display the current location of the cursor
q9c2: give a reference of units of length (dots) on a plotted or printed drawing
q9c3: display a visual reference of units of length on the screen
q9c4: change the Limits of the drawing area
q10N: The primary difference between model space and a Layout tab(s) is.
q10c1: the Model tab is used for drawing in 3D and a Layout is used for drawing in 2D
q10c2: the Model tab is where you create the drawing and a Layout tab represents the sheet that you will plot or print on
q10c4: the Model tab displays the drawing you are copying from and the Layout tab is where you lay out the new drawing
